name: The Final Season of "Cheers" Quiz | 'Cheers'- Season 11 | 25 Questions

questions.text: How did the bar burn down?
questions.correct: Rebecca left a cigarette burning in the garbage can.
questions.explanation:
Rebecca left a cigarette burning in the garbage can.

	This episode has one of the best endings. Sam kicks Rebecca out of the bar because she was the cause of the fire. Rebecca then tells Sam that what she did was bad, but what he did is worse because he did it on purpose. This is so true, to hurt someone intentionally is a lot worse than if one accidentally hurts someone.

questions.text: What does Rebecca break even on?
questions.explanation:
slot machine.

	Carla rigged the machine to make Rebecca win, but it was out of money so all Rebecca got was her nickel back.

questions.text: Who challenged Sam in a ladies man contest?
questions.explanation:
Henri.

	Henri thinks that Sam has fallen as King of Babes, until after the contest when Sam gets a date with three woman at once.

questions.text: What is the name of the place that does tune-ups according to the jingle?
questions.explanation:
Fred's.

	John Mahoney who plays the jingle writer, plays Frasier's father Martin Crane on "Frasier".

questions.text: What is the name of the bouncer Sam hires?
questions.explanation:
Tiny.

	Tiny was played by Don Gibb. He played Ray Jackson in "Blood Sport".

questions.text: Who played Dr. Louis Pascal?
questions.explanation:
Peter Vogt.

	Peter Vogt has also guest starred on "Murphy Brown", "Newhart" and "Knots Landing" among other shows.

questions.text: Who does Cliff think moved into his building?
questions.explanation:
Hitler.

	This is also the same episode in which Carla declares she loves Hill. She then thinks that is why he had a heart attack.

questions.text: What branch of the service was Norm in?
questions.explanation:
Coast Guard.

	Rebecca's father was in the Navy.

questions.text: Where does Rebecca say ham comes from?
questions.correct: Big funny shaped cans in aisle six
options: Everyone knows ham comes from a pig
The theatre is filled with hams
questions.explanation:
Big funny shaped cans in aisle six.

	Rebecca doesn't want Woody to kill his pig, so she tries to rescue it.

questions.text: What is the name of Frasier's secretary?
questions.explanation:
Shauna.

	Shauna was played by Kristen Cloke. She married writer/director Glen Morgan and they have one son named Winslow.

questions.text: When Robin comes back poor what does everyone tear the bar apart looking for?
questions.explanation:
money belt.

	Robin didn't actually have a money belt in the bar this time, but he let them do it anyway. He claims he never liked the people at "Cheers".

questions.text: Which one of Carla's kids gets married in "Loathe and Marriage"?
questions.explanation:
Serafina.

	This wedding caused a problem for Carla because Seraphina wanted Nick her father, to give her away, but Carla hates Nick and didn't even want him at the wedding.

questions.text: What is the toast they say about Lilith in "Is There a Doctor in the Howe"?
questions.explanation:
Lilith stinks.

	Frasier got a letter from Lilith saying she wanted a divorce. We later find out that Pascal wrote the letter, not Lilith.

questions.text: What two problems does Pascal have?
options: he's a drug addict and insane
questions.explanation:
he's claustrophobic and insane.

	They found out Louis was claustrophobic when they closed the Eco-pod.

questions.text: According to Gus O'Malley what does the C in "Cheers" stand for?
questions.explanation:
courtesy.

	According to the little ditty he made Carla and Rebecca say the letters are "C-courtesy, H-honesty E-energy E-more energy R-Right, Gus for which you will S-say when I (Gus) gives an order."

questions.text: How much does Gary's Old Towne Tavern charge for beer on St. Patrick's Day?
questions.explanation:
$5.00

	At the end of this episode Gary's Old Towne Tavern is destroyed by Gary himself.

questions.text: When Sam locks his keys in the bar who does he end up staying with for the night?
questions.explanation:
Cliff's house.

	He goes to everyone's houses, but ends up at Cliff's. He leaves Cliff's because Cliff is annoying but when he goes to Rebecca she locks herself out of her house so both her and Sam end up at Cliff's for the night.

questions.text: Which one of the "Little Rascals" guest starred on "Cheers"?
questions.explanation:
Spanky.

	Spanky McFarland was the last of the "Little Rascals" to die. He died on June 30, 1993 from a heart attack. It wasn't long after making this episode.

questions.text: Who did Carla have sex with after she had been drinking too much?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	Paul was played by Paul Wilson. In 11 years this is the only episode that really featured him in the main plot.

questions.text: What does Rebecca say Mr. Gaines' first name is?
questions.explanation:
Mister.

	She says, "If I play my cards right I might just become Mrs. Mister Gaines."

questions.text: Did Cliff really kill his mother?
questions.explanation:
No.

	He had put his mother in a home.

questions.text: What was the name of the plumber that Rebecca dated and later married?
questions.explanation:
Don Santry.

	Tom Berenger co-starred with Kirstie Alley in the 1988 movie "Shoot to Kill". He played Jonathan and she played Sarah.

questions.text: What does Rebecca say when Don asks her to marry him the first time?
questions.correct: Oh Don, of course I won't
questions.explanation:
Oh Don, of course I won't.

	She says all three responses, but "Oh Don, of course I won't" is the first one. She doesn't say yes to him until much later in the episode.

questions.text: How old is two year old Chelsea?
questions.explanation:
1.

	Rebecca says this when Diane asks about the kids that Rebecca and Sam have. She is an emotional wreck because Don had just left her when she didn't say yes to his marriage proposal.

questions.text: What is the very last line of the show?
questions.explanation:
Sorry, we're closed.

	Sam speaks the last line before heading to the backroom of "Cheers". The last episode was followed that night by a special "Tonight Show with Jay Leno" at the Bull and Finch Pub in Boston, the bar that was the model for "Cheers".
